Utilize public transportation: If all roads disappeared, public transportation such as buses, trains, and subways would become even more important. People would need to rely on these systems to get around their town or city.
Use bicycles: Bicycles are a great alternative to cars and can be used to get around town. People could ride bikes to work, school, and other destinations.
Walk: Walking is a simple and effective way to get around. People could walk to nearby shops, restaurants, and parks.
Use drones: Drones could be used to deliver goods and services to people's homes. People could also use drones to transport themselves around town.
Use waterways: If all roads disappeared, people could use waterways such as rivers and lakes to get around. People could use boats and kayaks to navigate these waterways.
